intro: Calyptrotheca stuhlmannii, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to South Africa, characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a strong, spicy fragrance when crushed. Calyptrotheca stuhlmannii is valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its visual appeal.
